Description: Both the Azure Local Deployment Architecture and the Cloud Infrastructure Security Model identify unauthorized access as a critical threat.
Both models emphasize the importance of encryption for data at rest and in transit.
Both models highlight the risk of denial of service attacks targeting critical infrastructure.
Both models align with industry best practices for security compliance, particularly regarding data protection and access management.
Both models identify risks associated with insecure configurations and mismanagement of cloud resources.

Source: Frequent incidents of unauthorized access attempts across various systems indicate a common vulnerability.
Multiple instances of data tampering have been reported, highlighting the need for stronger integrity checks.
Recurring denial of service attacks across cloud and on-premises environments suggest a need for improved defenses.
